cursor Class

Defined in: lib/api/cursor.js:2
Module: cursor
Parent Module: arango

The api module to validate, test, execute arangodb queries and fetch the data..

  • Index
  • Methods

Item Index

Methods

  • create
  • delete
  • explain
  • get
  • query

Methods

create

(
  • data
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/cursor.js:25

Executes query string.

Parameters:

  • data Object
    • A JSON Object containing the query data:
    • query String
      • contains the query string to be executed.
    • [count=false] Boolean optional
      • boolean flag that indicates whether the number of documents in the result set should be returned in the "count" attribute of the result.
    • [batchSize] Integer optional
      • maximum number of result documents to be transferred from the server to the client in one roundtrip (optional). If this attribute is not set, a server-controlled default value will be used.
    • [bindVars] Object optional

      key/value list of bind parameters.

    • [options] Object optional
      • key/value list of extra options for the query
      • [fullCount=false] Boolean optional
        - if set to true and the query contains a LIMIT clause, then the result will contain an extra attribute extra with a sub-attribute fullCount. This sub-attribute will contain the number of documents in the result before the last LIMIT in the query was applied. It can be used to count the number of documents that match certain filter criteria, but only return a subset of them, in one go.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

(
  • id
  • callback
)

deletes a cursor.

Parameters:

  • id String
    • The id of the cursor to fetch data for
  • callback Function

(
  • data
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/cursor.js:73

Explains a query.

Parameters:

  • data Object
    • A JSON Object containing the query data:
    • query String
      • contains the query string to be executed.
    • [count=false] Boolean optional
      • boolean flag that indicates whether the number of documents in the result set should be returned in the "count" attribute of the result.
    • [batchSize] Number optional
      • maximum number of result documents to be transferred from the server to the client in one roundtrip (optional). If this attribute is not set, a server-controlled default value will be used.
    • [bindVars] Object optional

      key/value list of bind parameters.

    • [options] Object optional
      • key/value list of extra options for the query
      • [fullCount=false] Boolean optional
        - if set to true and the query contains a LIMIT clause, then the result will contain an extra attribute extra with a sub-attribute fullCount. This sub-attribute will contain the number of documents in the result before the last LIMIT in the query was applied. It can be used to count the number of documents that match certain filter criteria, but only return a subset of them, in one go.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

  • callback

Promise

Defined in lib/api/cursor.js:49

Validates a query.

Parameters:

  • data Object
    • A JSON Object containing the query data:
    • query String
      • contains the query string to be executed.
    • [count=false] Boolean optional
      • boolean flag that indicates whether the number of documents in the result set should be returned in the "count" attribute of the result.
    • [batchSize] Integer optional
      • maximum number of result documents to be transferred from the server to the client in one roundtrip (optional). If this attribute is not set, a server-controlled default value will be used.
    • [bindVars] Object optional

      key/value list of bind parameters.

    • [options] Object optional
      • key/value list of extra options for the query
      • [fullCount=false] Boolean optional
        - if set to true and the query contains a LIMIT clause, then the result will contain an extra attribute extra with a sub-attribute fullCount. This sub-attribute will contain the number of documents in the result before the last LIMIT in the query was applied. It can be used to count the number of documents that match certain filter criteria, but only return a subset of them, in one go.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.
